intro: Phymatodes alternifolia, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its basal rosette of blue-gray, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by seed capsules that release wind-dispersed seeds. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access groundwater during dry periods. Phymatodes alternifolia plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
